page.title: 05STOCKTON-DARLINGTON RAILWAY
page.content: In 1815, a local industrialist wanted to find a new and cheaper way of moving coal from the Durham coalfield to the ports on the River Tees.The{Stockton-Darlington railway was built with the help of George Stephenson, and became the first passenger railway in the world. The present double track line still follows the original route through this area, with a{new station}built especially for the airport.The line links Darlington with Western parts of Cleveland carrying both passengers and industrial goods. There is a regular{passenger service with trains at \ hourly intervals throughout the day, but not all of them stop at the airport. Most of the passengers are passing through as few of the locals use the service at all.
